item.title: Aid agencies say the Israeli military has been attacking their workers for months
item.dc:creator: Gabe Joselow and Aurora Almendral and Doha Madani and Dan De Luce and Caroline Radnofsky and Matthew Mulligan
item.description: 224 aid workers have been killed since the start of the war, as the death of WCK aid workers highlight the failure of the Israeli military to protect aid workers in line with international humanitarian law.

media:content.media:text: A man displays blood-stained British, Polish, and Australian passports after an Israeli airstrike in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, on April 1, 2024, killed seven World Central Kitchen workers.
media:content.media:description: A man displays blood-stained British, Polish, and Australian passports after an Israeli airstrike in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, on April 1, 2024, killed seven World Central Kitchen workers.

media:content.media:text: Palestinians walking in front of the closed headquarters of the World Central Kitchen on April 3, 2024, west of Nuseirat, central Gaza.
media:content.media:description: Two women walk past the closed headquarters of the World Central Kitchen in central Gaza.

media:content.media:text: Palestinians look a vehicle in Deir Al-Balah, Gaza, on April 2, 2024, the day after it was destroyed by an Israeli airstrike that killed World Central Kitchen workers.
media:content.media:description: Palestinians look at a vehicle Monday in Deir Al-Balah, Gaza, the day after it was destroyed by an Israeli airstrike that killed World Central Kitchen workers.

item.title: UConn defeats Alabama 86-72 to face Purdue in NCAA championship
item.description: The winner will face either UConn or Alabama in Monday's national title game.

media:content.media:text: UConn center Youssouf Singare (24) and forward Samson Johnson (35) celebrate after after their win against Alabama in a NCAA college basketball game at the Final Four, Saturday, April 6, 2024, in Glendale, Ariz. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip)
media:content.media:description: UConn center Youssouf Singare (24) and forward Samson Johnson (35) celebrate after after their win against Alabama in a NCAA college basketball game at the Final Four, Saturday, April 6, 2024, in Glendale, Ariz. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip)

item.title: Some students are choosing affordable safety schools over dream colleges after botched FAFSA rollout
item.dc:creator: Haley Messenger and Sara Ruberg
item.description: Bricelyn Harrelson didn’t plan to spend six months applying to college.

media:content.media:text: Photo Illustrations: Collegiate pennants that read "Delayed," "Community College," "Shifting Savings," "Safety School" and "Loans"
media:content.media:description: Some households are already weathering fallout from the issues bogging down the FAFSA process this year.

media:content.media:text: Kerri Harrelson, left, with her daughter, Bricelyn, who doesn’t yet know where she’ll be attending college in the fall.
media:content.media:description: Kerri Harrelson, left, with her daughter, Bricelyn, who doesn’t yet know where she’ll be attending college in the fall.

media:content.media:text: Kelly Gainor, right, has cut back on retirement savings to free up tuition money.
media:content.media:description: Kelly Gainor, right, has cut back on retirement savings to free up tuition money.

media:content.media:text: Roman Alvarado, center, locked down his spot on a university soccer team before knowing his final aid package.
media:content.media:description: Roman Alvarado, center, locked down his spot on a university soccer team before knowing his final aid package.

media:content.media:credit: Courtesy of the Maynard Payne family
media:content.media:text: Olivia Maynard Payne, left, committed to a Florida state school that offered her a full ride, rather than hold out hope of attending pricier private colleges that admitted her.
media:content.media:description: Olivia Maynard Payne, left, committed to a Florida state school that offered her a full ride, rather than hold out hope of attending pricier private colleges that admitted her.

media:content.media:text: The Schendzielos family has four children currently in or applying to college.
media:content.media:description: The Schendzielos family has four children currently in or applying to college.

item.title: Nationals pitcher, 2019 World Series MVP Stephen Strasburg retires from baseball
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosenstein
item.description: Washington Nationals starting pitcher and 2019 World Series MVP Stephen Strasburg officially retired from baseball Saturday.

media:content.media:text: World Series - Washington Nationals v Houston Astros - Game Two
media:content.media:description: Stephen Strasburg #37 of the Washington Nationals delivers the pitch against the Houston Astros during the first inning in Game Two of the 2019 World Series.

media:content.media:text: World Series - Washington Nationals v Houston Astros - Game Seven
media:content.media:description: Stephen Strasburg #37 of the Washington Nationals celebrates after defeating the Houston Astros 6-2 in Game Seven to win the 2019 World Series in Houston.

item.title: Biden may have trouble getting on Ohio’s general election ballot, state’s top election official warns
item.dc:creator: Emma Barnett and Alexandra Marquez
item.description: Ohio’s secretary of state on Friday signaled that the Democratic National Convention may take place too late for President Joe Biden to appear on the general election ballot in the state, according to a letter obtained by NBC News.

media:content.media:text: Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: Joe Biden on April 3, 2024, in Washington, D.C.

media:content.media:text: Frank LaRose
media:content.media:description: Ohio Secretary of State Frank LaRose in Hamilton, Ohio, on March 18.

item.title: How to best photograph the total solar eclipse on your phone
item.dc:creator: Chelsea Stahl and Mirna Alsharif
item.description: A total solar eclipse will cross North America Monday and eclipse mania has seized the U.S., with concerts, viewing parties and even a mass wedding planned along the path of totality to witness the once-in-a-generation celestial event.

media:content.media:text: A phone wearing eclipse ISO glasses.

item.title: $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot drawing delayed over ticket verification issue
item.dc:creator: Rudy Chinchilla
item.description: Saturday’s highly anticipated $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot drawing was delayed over what the Multi-State Lottery Association said was one lottery’s need for additional time to complete security procedures.

media:content.media:text: Powerball tickets are shown in front of a screen displaying the estimated jackpot
media:content.media:description: Powerball tickets are shown in front of a screen displaying the estimated jackpot on Wednesday in Surfside, Fla. The Powerball had grown to an estimated $1.3 billion ahead of Saturday's drawing.

item.title: Stolen son: A hostage’s mom fights to bring her child home from Gaza
item.description: Rachel Goldberg-Polin's son, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin, was taken by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023. In the six months since, she has become a vocal advocate in the effort to free the over 100 hostages that remain in Gaza — all while bearing the daily burden of pretending to be normal.

media:content.media:title: Stolen son: A hostage’s mom fights to bring her child home from Gaza
media:content.media:description: Rachel Goldberg-Polin's son, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin, was taken by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023. In the six months since, she has become a vocal advocate in the effort to free the over 100 hostages that remain in Gaza — all while bearing the daily burden of pretending to be normal.

item.title: UFC champ Jon Jones accused of threatening to kill woman collecting his urine for drug test
item.dc:creator: Dennis Romero and Rudy Chinchilla
item.description: UFC heavyweight champion Jon Jones was arrested Saturday based on allegations that he assaulted and threatened to kill a drug testing agent, police in New Mexico said.

media:content.media:text: Jon Jones meets with the media following his win over Cyril Gane at UFC 285 on March 5, 2023
media:content.media:description: Jon Jones meets with the media following his win over Cyril Gane at UFC 285 on March 5, 2023.

media:content.media:description: Powerball tickets are shown in front of a screen displaying the estimated jackpot on Wednesday in Surfside, Fla. The Powerball had grown to an estimated $1.3 billion ahead of Saturday's drawing.

item.title: Trans athletes should be allowed to play women's sports, South Carolina coach Dawn Staley says
item.dc:creator: Rudy Chinchilla and The Associated Press
item.description: Transgender athletes should be allowed to compete in women’s sports, South Carolina women’s basketball coach Dawn Staley said ahead of her team’s NCAA Tournament championship game.

media:content.media:text: South Carolina Gamecocks head coach Dawn Staley during an open practice session ahead of the 2024 NCAA Women's National Championship at Rocket Mortgage Fieldhouse in Cleveland, Ohio, on April 6, 2024.
media:content.media:description: South Carolina Gamecocks head coach Dawn Staley during an open practice session ahead of the 2024 NCAA Women's National Championship at Rocket Mortgage Fieldhouse in Cleveland, Ohio, on Saturday.

item.title: California authorities issue 'endangered' advisory after mother, 2 boys vanish
item.dc:creator: Dennis Romero and Lindsay Good
item.description: The California Highway Patrol on Saturday issued an "Endangered Missing Advisory" for two young boys believed to have been taken by their mother.

media:content.media:text: Intersection of Montecito Ave & San Pierre Way
media:content.media:description: An intersection in Mountain View where police say Taylor Wu, 38, and sons Daniel, 9, and David, 4, were last seen before going missing.

item.title: Iowa-UConn Final Four matchup draws 14.2 million viewers, most in women's college basketball history
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosenstein
item.description: Iowa’s 71-69 win against UConn in Friday’s NCAA Final Four game drew 14.2 million viewers, the most in women’s college basketball history, according to ESPN.

media:content.media:text: Caitlin Clark
media:content.media:description: Iowa's Caitlin Clark shoots a free throw during the NCAA Women's Final Four basketball game against UConn on Friday.

media:content.media:text: Caitlin Clark of the Iowa Hawkeyes
media:content.media:description: Caitlin Clark and her Iowa Hawkeyes teammates huddle after beating the UConn Huskies in the NCAA Women's Final Four game on Friday. Iowa defeated Connecticut 71-69.

item.title: The world’s oldest man says the secret to his longevity is luck, plus regular fish and chips
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: LONDON — The world’s oldest man says the secret to his long life is luck, moderation — and fish and chips every Friday.

media:content.media:text: John Alfred Tinniswood
media:content.media:description: Englishman John Alfred Tinniswood, 111, has been confirmed as the new holder of the title by Guinness World Records.

item.title: Eight dead in two Russian strikes on Kharkiv, officials say
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Two Russian strikes on Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city, killed eight civilians and injured at least 10 early on Saturday and in the afternoon, regional officials said.

media:content.media:text: Aftermath of Russian missile and drone attack in Kharkiv
media:content.media:description: An employee in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday carries out a door from a fuel station damaged during Russian missile and drone strikes.

media:content.media:text: Aftermath of Russian missile and drone attack in Kharkiv
media:content.media:description: A view shows a fuel station damaged during Russian missile and drone strikes in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on Saturday.

item.title: Superman's first appearance sells for $6 million, becoming world's most valuable comic
item.dc:creator: Rob Wile
item.description: A comic book featuring Superman's first-ever appearance has sold for $6 million, making it the most valuable comic edition in existence.

media:content.media:text: The June, 1938 cover of Action Comics.
media:content.media:description: The June, 1938 cover of Action Comics.

item.title: Diddy posts seemingly defiant video amid sexual misconduct allegations
item.dc:creator: Variety
item.description: As accusations of sexual misconduct continue to be leveled against Sean “Diddy” Combs — and now his son — the embattled artist and entrepreneur posted a seemingly defiant video and caption on Instagram Friday.

media:content.media:text: Sean "Diddy" Combs
media:content.media:description: Sean "Diddy" Combs in 2023 in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Eight men charged by feds with robbing train cars carrying Corona and Modelo cases
item.dc:creator: Rob Wile
item.description: Eight men have been charged by federal authorities with stealing numerous cases of beer from train cars and other facilities across the Northeast over the course of nearly two years.

media:content.media:text: Trains in the Bronx.
media:content.media:description: Trains on Oct. 11, 2022 in the Bronx borough of New York City.

item.title: Many can’t wait for the eclipse. Some can’t wait until it’s over.
item.dc:creator: Harriet Baskas
item.description: A Texas city says residents have groused that the eclipse is no big deal and celebrating it wastes money. Authorities in many places are bracing for epic traffic.

media:content.media:text: An angry face emoji as one phase of a total eclipse
media:content.media:description: Not all residents and public officials in the path of totality are enthused about welcoming eclipse tourists.

item.title: Trump lawyers continue to press for delay in classified documents case
item.dc:creator: Katherine Doyle and Alexandra Marquez
item.description: Lawyers for former President Donald Trump and his co-defendants in the classified documents case are arguing that a potential trial date should continue to be pushed back.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump in Grand Rapids, Mich., on April 2, 2024.

item.title: Biden may have trouble getting on Ohio’s general election ballot, state’s top election official warns
item.dc:creator: Emma Barnett and Alexandra Marquez
item.description: Ohio’s secretary of state on Friday signaled that the Democratic National Convention may take place too late for President Joe Biden to appear on the general election ballot in the state, according to a letter obtained by NBC News.

media:content.media:text: Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: Joe Biden on April 3, 2024, in Washington, D.C.

media:content.media:text: Frank LaRose
media:content.media:description: Ohio Secretary of State Frank LaRose in Hamilton, Ohio, on March 18.

item.title: Country star Colt Ford suffers heart attack following Arizona concert
item.dc:creator: Mirna Alsharif and Diana Dasrath
item.description: Country star Colt Ford is in the intensive care unit after suffering a heart attack Thursday, according to a representative for the musician.

media:content.media:text: Colt Ford
media:content.media:description: Colt Ford performs on Sept. 17, 2023 in Nashville, Tenn. (Photo by Jason Kempin/Getty Images)
